question.body: Which of the following is not matched correctly with its description?

multiple_choice.choice: Erythropoiesis occurs in the bone marrow.
Red blood cells have a life span of 30 days.
Macrophages of the spleen or liver remove damaged RBC.
Transferrin can carry iron through the blood stream.

response.feedback: Incorrect. Erythropoiesis does take place in red bone marrow.
Correct. The average lifespan of a RBC is 120 days.
Incorrect. The macrophages of the liver and spleen phagocytose damaged RBCs.
Incorrect. Transferrin will bind to iron, enter the blood stream and then transport that iron to other body tissues, such as red bone marrow so that new erythrocytes can be generated.
